ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Well, if you are a first year econ phd, you have to take this. If you are in another program, honestly, I just think that this course is too technical and too difficult to be sensible.
Most people are required to who take this class.
It's a very good basic course on Game Theory and Contract Theory.
Yes,it introduces a lot of useful topics.
this is what game theory is all about. if you are interested in strategic interaction you should take this course.
It's a challenging course, but with very useful material for future research. I would certainly recommend it.
It's a wonderful graduate game theory course. I would definitely recommend this course to other students.
Definitely you'll learn a lot, but very very challenging and time consuming.
Highly recommend. Even though the workload was ridiculous at times, we survived and learned a lot.
Yes, the concepts are important to know.
It is a required course, but I would recommend it anyway.
Coming from outside the department, I would highly recommend Econ 501 to any student who would like to potentially one day be a producer of game theoretic results, not merely a consumer.
Yes I will.
yes

The course goes through the basic theory of games, information, and mechanism design. I would recommend the course because the concepts from this class are very important to understanding many types of economics research.
Yes, totally. Great Introduction to Game Theory, most of the relevant topics in Game Theory were covered.
very rewarding course
Yes
excellent

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course was absolutely essential for my profession.
sure, a little bit.
it introduces a lot of necessary knowleage, which are of essential to the future research.
i learned a lot about game theory.
I will definitely consider using a game theoretical model for my future research as a result of this class.
It's a good starting point for game theory and microeconomics theory
The course was difficult, but I learned a lot.
I imagine it helped a lot with my understanding! I certainly didn't understand game theory the first time I took it (not at Yale).
It helped me form the basis for further study of Micro Theory and was as such extremely helpful.
Laid theoretical foundation of the research.
We'll see. I haven't started writing yet, or even chosen a topic for that matter.
My knowledge of game theory is much better now.
As I hope to use game theory in the future, the tools sharpened in this course will likely be of direct relevance.
a lot
This course will be very important to understanding certain models in the literature. It is also likely that I will incorporate some of the concepts into my own research.
I am very interested in the part of mechanism of design, I will definitely used it later on for my research.
Very helpful!
Extended knowledge of game theory
Very useful
